import yaml
import copy
import random

from datetime import date

import global_parameters as gp
from classes.Component import generalize_unit_id
from classes.Service import Service

"""
def old_make_oscar_p_input_file(deployment, service_number=0, is_single_service=False):

    services = []
    clusters = []
    clusters_dict = {}

    run_parameters = copy.deepcopy(gp.run_parameters)

    i = service_number

    if is_single_service:
        run_parameters["run"]["final_processing"] = True
    else:
        run_parameters["run"]["final_processing"] = False

    run_parameters["run"]["stop_at_run"] = gp.current_base_index + 1

    if is_single_service:
        run_parameters["input_files"]["storage_bucket"] = "bucket" + str(i)
        run_parameters["input_files"]["filename"] = None
    else:  # if it's full workflow
        # run_parameters["run"]["repetitions"] = 1  # todo keep?
        pass

    for s in deployment:  # single components in deployments
        name = gp.testing_components[s]["name"].replace('_', '-')
        r = s.split("@")[1]

        is_lambda = (r == "AWS Lambda")

        if is_single_service:  # lambdas are never tested as single services
            input_bucket = "temp" + str(i)
            output_bucket = "trash" + str(i)
        else:
            input_bucket = "bucket" + str(i)
            output_bucket = "bucket" + str(i + 1)

        services.append({name: {
            "cluster": r,
            "image": gp.images[s]["image"],
            "input_bucket": input_bucket,
            "output_bucket": output_bucket,
            "cpu": gp.images[s]["cpu"],
            "memory": gp.images[s]["memory"],
            "parallelism": gp.testing_components[s]["parallelism"],
            "is_lambda": is_lambda
        }})

        # easier to use a dict here to avoid duplications
        if r not in clusters_dict.keys():
            clusters_dict[r] = gp.resources[r]

        i += 1

    # converts the dict to a list
    for c in clusters_dict.keys():
        clusters_dict[c]["nodes"] = gp.clusters_node_requirements[c]["nodes"]
        clusters.append({c: clusters_dict[c]})

    oscar_p_input_file = {
        "services": services,
        "clusters": clusters
    }

    # oscar_p_input_file = oscar_p_input_file | run_parameters
    oscar_p_input_file.update(run_parameters)

    oscar_p_input_file = {"configuration": oscar_p_input_file}

    with open("input.yaml", "w") as file:
        yaml.dump(oscar_p_input_file, file, sort_keys=False)

    # input(">_")
"""



[docs]def make_oscar_p_input_file():

    run_parameters = copy.deepcopy(gp.run_parameters)
    # run_parameters["run"]["final_processing"] = is_last_run
    run_parameters["run"]["stop_at_run"] = gp.current_base_index + 1

    clusters_dict = {}
    for unit in gp.current_deployment:
        r = unit.split("@")[1]

        # easier to use a dict here to avoid duplications

        if r not in clusters_dict.keys():
            temp_resource = gp.resources[r]

            clusters_dict[r] = {
                "is_physical": temp_resource.is_physical(),
                "oscarcli_alias": temp_resource.oscarcli_alias,
                "storage_provider": temp_resource.storage_provider,
                "storage_provider_alias": temp_resource.storage_provider_alias,
                "ssh": temp_resource.ssh,
                "total_nodes": 1,
                "max_cpu_cores": temp_resource.max_cpu_cores,
                "max_memory_mb": temp_resource.max_memory_mb
            }

    # converts the dict to a list
    clusters = []
    for c in clusters_dict.keys():
        clusters_dict[c]["nodes"] = gp.resources_node_requirements[c]
        clusters.append({c: clusters_dict[c]})

    # converts the services list to the correct format
    services = []
    for s in gp.current_services_list:
        services.append({s["name"].replace('_', '-'): s})

    oscar_p_input_file = {
        "services": services,
        "clusters": clusters
    }

    # oscar_p_input_file = oscar_p_input_file | run_parameters
    oscar_p_input_file.update(run_parameters)

    oscar_p_input_file = {"configuration": oscar_p_input_file}

    with open("input.yaml", "w") as file:  # todo this will have to be written inside current_deployment_dir instead
        yaml.dump(oscar_p_input_file, file, sort_keys=False)

    return




[docs]def make_oscar_p_input_file_single(service, service_number=0):

    services = []
    clusters = []
    clusters_dict = {}

    run_parameters = copy.deepcopy(gp.run_parameters)

    i = service_number

    # run_parameters["run"]["final_processing"] = is_last_run
    run_parameters["run"]["stop_at_run"] = gp.current_base_index + 1

    run_parameters["input_files"]["storage_bucket"] = "bucket" + str(i)
    run_parameters["input_files"]["filename"] = None

    container_id = service.split("@")[0]

    component = gp.containers[service].parent

    name = component.name.replace('_', '-')

    r = service.split("@")[1]

    is_lambda = (r == "AWS Lambda")

    if is_lambda:
        input_bucket = gp.current_services_list[service_number]["input_bucket"]
    else:
        input_bucket = "temp" + str(i)

    output_bucket = "trash" + str(i)

    container = gp.containers[service]

    services.append({name: {
        "cluster": r,
        "image": container.image,
        "input_bucket": input_bucket,
        "output_bucket": output_bucket,
        "cpu": container.cpu,
        "memory": container.memory,
        "parallelism": container.parent.parallelism,
        "is_lambda": is_lambda
    }})

    # easier to use a dict here to avoid duplications
    if r not in clusters_dict.keys():
        temp_resource = gp.resources[r]

        clusters_dict[r] = {
            "is_physical": temp_resource.is_physical(),
            "oscarcli_alias": temp_resource.oscarcli_alias,
            "storage_provider": temp_resource.storage_provider,
            "storage_provider_alias": temp_resource.storage_provider_alias,
            "ssh": temp_resource.ssh,
            "total_nodes": 1,
            "max_cpu_cores": temp_resource.max_cpu_cores,
            "max_memory_mb": temp_resource.max_memory_mb
        }

    i += 1

    # converts the dict to a list
    for c in clusters_dict.keys():
        clusters_dict[c]["nodes"] = gp.resources_node_requirements[c]
        clusters.append({c: clusters_dict[c]})

    oscar_p_input_file = {
        "services": services,
        "clusters": clusters
    }

    # oscar_p_input_file = oscar_p_input_file | run_parameters
    oscar_p_input_file.update(run_parameters)

    oscar_p_input_file = {"configuration": oscar_p_input_file}

    with open("input.yaml", "w") as file:
        yaml.dump(oscar_p_input_file, file, sort_keys=False)

    return




[docs]def make_current_services():
    """
    transforms the unit into sequential services, by adding aptly named buckets and other useful info
    """

    gp.current_services_list = []
    gp.current_services_dict = {}
    gp.has_lambdas = False

    i = 0

    for unit in gp.current_deployment:  # single components in deployments

        container = gp.containers[generalize_unit_id(unit)]
        name = container.parent.name
        """
        r = unit.split("@")[1]
        is_lambda = gp.resources[r].is_lambda()

        input_bucket = "bucket" + str(i)
        output_bucket = "bucket" + str(i + 1)

        if is_lambda:
            s3_main_bucket_name = gp.resources[r].bucket_name
            input_bucket = s3_main_bucket_name + "/"
            output_bucket = s3_main_bucket_name + "/"
            gp.has_lambdas = True

        current_service = {
            "unit": unit,
            "name": name,
            "cluster": r,
            "image": gp.containers[generalize_key(unit)].image,
            "input_bucket_index": i,
            "input_bucket": input_bucket,
            "output_bucket": output_bucket,
            "storage_provider_alias": gp.resources[r].storage_provider_alias,
            "oscarcli_alias": gp.resources[r].oscarcli_alias,
            "cpu": gp.containers[generalize_key(unit)].cpu,
            "memory": gp.containers[generalize_key(unit)].memory,
            "parallelism": gp.containers[generalize_key(unit)].parent.parallelism,
            "is_lambda": is_lambda
        }
        """

        current_service = Service(unit, name, i)

        gp.current_services_list.append(current_service)
        gp.current_services_dict[unit] = current_service

        i += 1

    # now needs to cycle over the services and connect the buckets in the right way between OSCAR and lambdas

    for i in range(len(gp.current_services_list)):
        current_service = gp.current_services_list[i]
        if i + 2 <= len(gp.current_services_list):
            next_service = gp.current_services_list[i + 1]
        else:
            return

        if next_service.is_lambda:
            current_service.output_bucket = next_service.output_bucket + current_service.name + "/output"
            next_service.output_bucket = next_service.input_bucket + next_service.name + "/output"
            next_service.input_bucket = current_service.output_bucket

    return




[docs]def run_scheduler():
    repetitions = gp.run_parameters["run"]["repetitions"]

    # create empty skeletons for runs
    run_names = ["Run #%s" % (i + 1) for i in range(gp.base_length * repetitions)]
    gp.scheduled_runs = dict.fromkeys(run_names, None)
    for key in gp.scheduled_runs:
        gp.scheduled_runs[key] = {"services": {}, "resources": {}}

    # add in services
    for service in gp.current_services_list:
        expanded_parallelism = [item for item in service.parallelism for i in range(repetitions)]

        for index, element in enumerate(expanded_parallelism):
            run_name = "Run #%s" % (index + 1)
            gp.scheduled_runs[run_name]["services"][service.unit] = {"parallelism": element}

    # add in resources
    for key, value in gp.resources_node_requirements.items():
        expanded_nodes = [item for item in value for i in range(repetitions)]

        for index, element in enumerate(expanded_nodes):
            run_name = "Run #%s" % (index + 1)
            gp.scheduled_runs[run_name]["resources"][key] = {"nodes": element}


    # print("\nRuns")
    # print(gp.scheduled_runs)
